title: jQuery Web Development and Programming
headline: Learn to use the feature-rich jQuery library to create dynamic, functional websites in this free online course.
description: This course will teach you all you need to create dynamic and functional websites using jQuery, the light, fast and feature-rich JavaScript library. This course will cover the basics of jQuery web design, such as selecting elements and recording events, as well as the more advanced features like proxy functions and extending functions using jQuery. In addition, discover how to create elements, effects and animations and use utility functions.

courseDescription:
This short course will teach you everything you need to create dynamic websites using the jQuery JavaScript library. It begins from scratch, demonstrating the process of setting up jQuery on various platforms and the web. First, explore how elements can be selected using multiple properties such as their IDs, attributes, class, contained text and so on. Next, the course illustrates how to use jQuery to retrieve and set element values, attributes, classes and HTML.

The first half of the course concludes by teaching you how to record various mouse and keyboard events and use these detected events to make websites more dynamic. The second half shows using jQuery to retrieve and modify an element’s CSS properties, classes and dimensions. This section also presents how to create and remove HTML elements using jQuery and how to add effects and animate elements on a web page.

The course concludes by examining how to retrieve from and send data to a server using jQuery and use utility functions like the ‘get’, ‘post’, ‘trim’ and ‘extend’ functions. jQuery is a popular JavaScript library revered for its light, fast and yet functional nature. We will provide you with the information you need to use this powerful library. Both new and experienced web developers will find the information contained in this course helpful. So start now and learn to use the powerful jQuery library in only three hours.

modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to the course content and will learn the process of setting up jQuery on various platforms, and on the web. You will also learn to select web elements based on properties such as their ID, attributes, class, and text.
topics: Introduction, Setup and Selectors – Learning Outcomes
Introduction, Setup and Selectors – Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn about various events that can be recorded using jQuery, and how to make these events trigger an action on a webpage. You will also learn to use jQuery to set and retrieve an element's attributes, HTML, data values, class values; as well as how to prevent the default behavior of an element.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn to use jQuery to retrieve and set the CSS properties of an element, as well as how to set element dimensions, add and remove HTML elements from a webpage. You will also learn to traverse a webpage and find elements based on their properties, and how to add effects like the fade and slide effects to a web page.
topics: HTML, CSS, Traversing & Effects – Learning Outcomes
HTML, CSS, Traversing & Effects – Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will be introduced to using jQuery to add asynchronous updating capability to a website using AJAX. You will also learn about a host of useful functions like the trim, inArray, post, and get methods, used to manipulate and modify webpage elements.
